snippet: Paulinho da Viola, 70, a musician and singer of Brazilian samba who has devoted himself to renewing the traditions of choro and samba de morro, made his Carnegie Hall debut on Wednesday.
abstract: Ben Ratliff reviews performance by Brazilian singer Paulinho da Viola at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: Paulinho da Viola, 70, a musician and singer of Brazilian samba who has devoted himself to renewing the traditions of choro and samba de morro, made his Carnegie Hall debut on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Paulinho da Viola, Brazilian Samba, at Carnegie Hall
headline.main: Samba Purred Serenely, With Stealthy Metaphor
headline.print_headline: Samba Purred Serenely, With Stealthy Metaphor
